Package fr.ign.artiscales.pm.decomposition

Class OBBBlockDecomposition

java.lang.Object
fr.ign.artiscales.pm.decomposition.OBBBlockDecomposition
public class OBBBlockDecomposition
extends java.lang.Object
Oriented Bounding Box algorithm implementation with methods to generate road network

  • Constructor Details

    • OBBBlockDecomposition

      public OBBBlockDecomposition()

  • Method Details

    • splitParcels

      public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection splitParcels​(org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature toSplit, double maximalArea, double maximalWidth, double harmonyCoeff, double noise, java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.LineString> extBlock, double streetWidth, boolean forceStreetAccess, int decompositionLevelWithoutStreet)
      Split the parcels into sub parcels. The parcel that are going to be cut must have a field matching the MarkParcelAttributeFromPosition.getMarkFieldName() field or "SPLIT" by default with the value of 1.

      Overload to split a single parcel.

      Parameters:
      toSplit - SimpleFeatureCollection of parcels
      maximalArea - Area of the parcel under which the parcel won't be anymore cut
      maximalWidth - Width of the parcel under which the parcel won't be anymore cut
      harmonyCoeff - intensity of the forcing of a parcel to be connected with a road
      extBlock - outside of the parcels (representing road or public space)
      streetWidth - With of the street composing the street network
      decompositionLevelWithoutStreet - Number of last iteration row for which no street network is generated
      forceStreetAccess - Is the polygon should be turned in order to assure the connection with the road ? Also regarding the harmony coeff. Most of cases, it's yes
      Returns:
      a collection of subdivised parcels

    • splitParcel

      public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection splitParcel​(org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature featToSplit, org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection roads, double maximalArea, double maximalWidth, double harmonyCoeff, double noise, java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.LineString> extBlock, double smallStreetWidth, int largeStreetLevel, double largeStreetWidth, boolean forceStreetAccess, int decompositionLevelWithoutStreet)

    • splitParcels

      public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection splitParcels​(org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection toSplit, java.io.File roadFile, fr.ign.artiscales.tools.parameter.ProfileUrbanFabric profile, boolean forceStreetAccess) throws java.io.IOException
      Split the parcels into sub parcels. The parcel that are going to be cut must have a field matching the MarkParcelAttributeFromPosition.getMarkFieldName() field or "SPLIT" by default with the value of 1.
      Parameters:
      toSplit - SimpleFeatureCollection of parcels
      roadFile - road file layer (can be null)
      profile - chosen ProfileUrbanFabric
      forceStreetAccess - Is the polygon should be turned in order to assure the connection with the road ? Also regarding the harmony coeff. Most of cases, it's yes
      Returns:
      a collection of subdivised parcels
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • splitParcels

      public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection splitParcels​(org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection toSplit, org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection roads, double maximalArea, double maximalWidth, double harmonyCoeff, double noise, java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.LineString> extBlock, double smallStreetWidth, int largeStreetLevel, double largeStreetWidth, boolean forceStreetAccess, int decompositionLevelWithoutStreet) throws java.io.IOException
      Split the parcels into sub parcels. The parcel that are going to be cut must have a field matching the MarkParcelAttributeFromPosition.getMarkFieldName() field or "SPLIT" by default with the value of 1.
      Parameters:
      toSplit - SimpleFeatureCollection of parcels
      roads - Road layer (can be null)
      maximalArea - Area of the parcel under which the parcel won't be anymore cut
      maximalWidth - Width of the parcel under which the parcel won't be anymore cut
      harmonyCoeff - intensity of the forcing of a parcel to be connected with a road
      noise - irregularity into parcel shape
      extBlock - outside of the parcels (representing road or public space)
      smallStreetWidth - Width of the small streets
      largeStreetLevel - Level of decomposition in which large streets are generated
      largeStreetWidth - Width of the large streets
      forceStreetAccess - Is the polygon should be turned in order to assure the connection with the road ? Also regarding the harmony coeff. Most of cases, it's yes
      decompositionLevelWithoutStreet - Number of last iteration row for which no street network is generated
      Returns:
      a collection of subdivised parcels
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • endCondition

      static boolean endCondition​(double area, double frontSideWidth, double maximalArea, double maximalWidth)
      End condition : either the area is below a threshold or width to road (which is ultimately allowed to be 0)
      Parameters:
      area - Area of the current parcel
      frontSideWidth - width of contact between road and parcel
      maximalArea - Area threshold
      maximalWidth - threshold of width of contact between road and parcel
      Returns:
      true if the algorithm must stop

    • computeSplittingPolygon

      public static java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon> computeSplittingPolygon​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon pol, java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.LineString> ext, boolean shortDirectionSplit, double harmonyCoeff, double noise, double smallRoadWidth, int largeRoadLevel, double largeRoadWidth, int decompositionLevelWithRoad, int decompositionLevel)
      Computed the splitting polygons composed by two boxes determined from the oriented bounding boxes split from a line at its middle.
      Parameters:
      pol - The input polygon
      ext - outside of the parcels (representing road or public space)
      shortDirectionSplit - It is split by the short edges or by the long edge.
      harmonyCoeff - intensity of the forcing of a parcel to be connected with a road
      noise - Irregularity into parcel shape
      smallRoadWidth - Width of the small streets
      largeRoadLevel - Level of decomposition in which large streets are generated
      largeRoadWidth - Width of the large streets
      decompositionLevelWithRoad -
      decompositionLevel -
      Returns:
      A list of split polygons

      Split the input polygon by another.
      Parameters:
      poly1 -
      poly2 -
      Returns:
      The splitting of Polygon1 with Polygon2

      polygons -
      Returns:

    • decompose

      public static fr.ign.artiscales.tools.geoToolsFunctions.vectors.Tree<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon,​java.lang.Integer>> decompose​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon polygon, java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.LineString> ext, double maximalArea, double maximalWidth, double noise, double epsilon, double streetWidth, boolean forceStreetAccess, int decompositionLevelWithStreet, int decompositionLevel)
      Decompose method. Overload to use no specific street SimpleFeatureCollection.

    • decompose

      public static fr.ign.artiscales.tools.geoToolsFunctions.vectors.Tree<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon,​java.lang.Integer>> decompose​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon polygon, java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.LineString> ext, org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection roads, double maximalArea, double maximalWidth, double noise, double harmonyCoeff, double smallStreetWidth, int largeStreetLevel, double largeStreetWidth, boolean forceStreetAccess, int decompositionLevelWithStreet, int decompositionLevel)
      Main method for OBB decomposition
      Parameters:
      polygon - Polygon of the parcel to be cut
      ext - outside of the parcels (representing road or public space)
      roads - Road layer (can be null)
      maximalArea - Area of the parcel under which the parcel won't be anymore cut
      maximalWidth - Width of the parcel under which the parcel won't be anymore cut
      noise - irregularity into parcel shape
      harmonyCoeff - intensity of the forcing of a parcel to be connected with a road
      smallStreetWidth - Width of the small streets
      largeStreetLevel - Level of decomposition in which large streets are generated
      largeStreetWidth - Width of the large streets
      forceStreetAccess - Is the polygon should be turned in order to assure the connection with the road ? Also regarding the harmony coeff. Most of cases, it's yes
      decompositionLevelWithStreet -
      decompositionLevel -
      Returns:
      A tree with the polygon decomposition
